I watched this last night. The A/V quality is excellent. There are two reasons why the file is larger than normal:

(1) The film is very dark, lighting-wise. Dark movies do not encode well. The image compression process preserves the bright information at the expense of the dark information. To get good quality in a dark movie you have use more bits.

(2) There are a lot of strobe-light scenes. Even some strobe-light torches! Strobe lighting also requires more bits to encode well because the entire image is changing all the time.
